text: Hi <@U2LEJ045D> - if you go to settings > log and track settings, you should be able to set the default state.

Hi all - Has anyone got experience of embedding Marketo forms in HubSpot pages? A client is looking for a solution to change the form submission redirect URL based on the page its on. I'm assuming a js solution is likely but I'd love to hear from others who have tried it.

Hi  all, i have  the requirement to  have a form with multi select dropdown fields. is this somehow possible in HS? I did not see it in the form builder so i went to create a Jotform Formular. While this works fine, i am not able to get the Jotform select options into a HS default dropdown field.
In HS there is no multi select dropdown option

AFAIK it’s not possible to have multiple values in a dropdown property (<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/contacts/property-field-types-in-HubSpot>).

However, you can create a new property which can store multiple values and fake the dropdown on the front-end with those values, using the Contact Properties API

That could also just populate from the Jotform.

<@U0122AC0PCN> I was able to create the Timeline Event Type through the API, but I still get an error trying to create it from the UI. Not a blocker for me though, I'll just use the API to create them in the mean time

Hi all, I´m about to start building a template pack to sell in the marketplace and im not really sure where to start building it. If i build it in my account (where i already have a website) it will get all the CSS and Menus from my website. Where is the best place to start building the templates from scratch?
Sorry about that. Only v3 allows it right now. The UI is still on v1 of our API, but upgrading that is on our near-term roadmap.
Anyone feel like list creation takes way tooooo long? I'm talking 10 minutes for a single filter list.
It is really strange – filtering is basically _instant_ in Contacts view but Lists take ages. Super confusing.
Been noticing this myself lately as well
phil, you want to marketo forms javascript api
This has some examples. you basically replace your current embed code with some javascript to get to what you are trying to do
If you want to accomplish somethign like this you would need to use multiple checkboxes and change the styling, and you'll need some javascript/jquery to make it work....
sign up for a marketplace account: <https://offers.HubSpot.com/free-marketplace-account>
Amazing! Thank you so much Nicholas
